dialogues.text: (nervously) Have you been to New York...? It's just across the bridge from me... I can actually see the Empire State Building if I stand on my bed... Where have you been? Tell me everything. The last time you wrote you said you were in Russia? I always wanted to go to Russia... Is it as cold as they say...? You wrote you met somebody... did it work out...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out) Remember this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's comes upon the BOOK her grandmother had read to them, Rudyard Kipling's "Just So." She sits on the bed... Benjamin sitting beside her... the two shoulder to shoulder... Daisy looking through the book... and reading....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is the picture of Old Man Kangaroo at five in the afternoon..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like an old man anymore...You always said you were different... I think you must be... He doesn't say anything. The two of them sitting with their backs to us like the old friends they are...They touch... acutely aware of their proximity and before it can go any further...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? Would you like to get something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love that... And the moment's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we see a taxi door being opened in slow motion... and Daisy, dressed for the night, glides out... a man helping her... and we see Benjamin a step behind getting out of the car... dressed to the nines... hair slicked, elegant... but nonetheless, a step behind... And we hear Daisy's voice, from somewhere else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I danced for a man named Ballenchine...He's a famous choreographer. He said I had a perfect line. They asked Ballenchine to describe what he did. He said, "I'm a carpenter." Isn't that amazing? In one of his rehearsals a dancer fell. He put it into the production. Can you imagine that in a classical ballet? A dancer intentionally falling? He isn't the only one, Agnes DeMille, Lincoln Kirstein, Richard Pleasant, Lucia Chase...There's a whole new word for dance now, it's called abstract..." The door to the restaurant held open for Daisy... another man showing her inside... Benjamin forgotten for the slightest of moments at the door... going after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded New Orleans restaurant. Daisy as a maitre d in slow motion is showing her to a table... Men's, and even women's, eyes following her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They have torn up all the conventions... the straight up and down style, all the things that bound dancers...It's not about the formality of the dance...the classical structure...it's about what the dancer's feeling...there are no rules; the movement can be tense or relaxed, abrupt or flowing, carefree or somber, it may suggest love or hate, attraction or repulsion. The unexpected shifts of weight or energy -- not just to shock but to reinvent tradition...putting the familiar form to new and unexpected uses. It's so basic Just you alone with your body... They reach a table... A chair in slow motion swept out for her to sit... another man in slow motion putting a napkin in her lap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They understand America's vigor and physicality -- they understand the freshness of the American people at their most modern, at their best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she told me about this world that she was so attracted to... names that didn't mean a thing to me...I didn't really hear very much of what she was saying. We watch them at the table... Benjamin listening, appreciating her... her face aglow with the intensity and the passion of youth... Caviar is brought over... vodka... She screws up her mouth not wanting to eat... We can sense he's telling her, what he's learned from Elizabeth Abbott, how to savor it... He feeds her a spoonful... They drink the vodka washing it down... she laughs, delighted... And we now hear what she is saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh my god, I've been just talking about myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm enjoying listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a cigarette... He instinctively looks for matches, a man gets there first, lighting her cigarette for her... he watches the smoke curl around her... appreciating her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you smoked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm old enough. I`m old enough for a lot of things....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin and Daisy, their silhouettes walking through the park... She puts her arm around his shoulder... being close to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go back tomorrow... I wish I could stay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a GAZEBO... Not a soul around... They stand for a moment in the silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In New York we stay up all night... I eat breakfast in a diner on Houston with red booths and watch the sun come up over the buildings... there's always something to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is in stark contrast to Benjamin's life... Daisy, takes off her shoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancers... don't need costumes or scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And showing him what she's been telling him about, she does a dance for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could imagine dancing completely naked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, dancing for him... While she dances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you read "D.H. Lawrence," his books were banned... The words are like making love....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, hands in his pockets appreciating her... she moves closer to him... She comes next to him and she kisses him... and when he doesn't respond... she tries a different tact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our group... you have to trust people... not be afraid... Sex... is a big part of it... A lot of the dancers... are lesbians... A woman wanted me to sleep with her....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that upset you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That someone wanted to sleep with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People should want to sleep with you... You're very desirable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back to the house... or get a room somewhere... we can put down your coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand, as if to lead him to the dark of the park... There's nothing he'd like more... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that I don't want to... I just can't... not tonight....Its just not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm old enough. And despite how available she is, how desirable she is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to New York, Daisy... Be with the people you are so fond of... You can only be young once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you are too old for me... I've been with older men... And when he still doesn't respond...   Daisy, rejected, takes up her shoes... And she starts   off... Benjamin coming beside her... but they're not   really walking together anymore... and the time for   them, this time, h gone away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only get so many chances to be with someone... I let her go... and I missed it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, caught in the distant time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so handsome in that suit... your hair... A Nurse looks in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sayin' the hurricane's going to miss us... blow right on by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's great. The Nurse goes off down the hall, her voice telling people the good news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that good news, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Daisy is in still another place and another time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hurricane.     It is going to miss us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just stay under the blankets with my mother. She said nothing would happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to keep reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) He said, "Things were becoming different for me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin lying on his bed, his glasses on, reading... "D.H. Lawrence"... We see he's squinting... We see his POINT OF VIEW, the print, is blurred... He takes off the glasses, looks at the print... and it's clear as a bell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need glasses anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, naked, standing in front of a full length mirror, looking at himself, studying himself....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hair had very little gray and grew like weeds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sense of smell was keener... my hearing more acute... I could walk further and faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can see outside an ambulance has arrived... to take away another of the old people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While everybody else was aging... I was getting younger... all alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he quietly looks at himself... There's a KNOCK on the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts something on, and opens the door. And as if to underscore what he's just said, he sees THOMAS BUTTON in his fifties himself now, leaning on crutches, his feet bandaged, standing in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Benjamin... Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Mr. Button... What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My foot was infected... I'm afraid they had to remove it... (beat, without irony) Welcome home, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar and restaurant crowded with men, many with various kinds of handicaps from the war, drinking away their demons... And we see Benjamin and Thomas sitting at a table... thick steaks, baked potatoes, drinks at their elbows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still drinking Sazerac with whiskey instead of brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a man of habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Are you still visiting the house on Bourbon street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him about my life... about my time at war... and he told me how he had devoted his business to making buttons for the war effort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war has been kind to the button industry... we had gone from making forty thousand buttons a day to making two hundred and fifty thousand... We employed ten times the number of workers... We were operating around the clock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he quiets... the sound of the busy restaurant... And after some moments Thomas tells him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how much longer I have to live...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that, Mr. Button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it seems like he is about to tell Benjamin the entire truth... but he can't bring himself and instead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any people. I keep to myself. I -- I'm frightened. I hope you won't mind... but whenever it's possible... I would enjoy your company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can, Mr. Button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quietly eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Benjamin, do you know anything about buttons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what holds my shirt on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old brick building with a painting on its side of a woman sewing on a button... "Button's Buttons." A driver waits outside of a "town car".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Thomas unlocking a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has been telling him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... comes from the French, "bouton," meaning a bud, or any round object... They come into a corridor. Thomas unlocking another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were originally decorative, jewelry sewn on clothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the quiet factory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The practice of buttoning originated in the 13th century... when baggy clothing was replaced with more form-fitting clothes... Thomas, on his crutches...past the lines of work benches... Mannequins in uniforms of the armed services... with their various gold and silver buttons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Button's Buttons has been in our family for one hundred and twenty- four years. My grandfather was a tailor. He had a small shop in Richmond. After the Civil War he came to New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father saw the wisdom of making our own buttons. The tailor shop grew to this... And today... (a smile) I can't sew a stitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin is interested, but the obvious question is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all very interesting.   But what do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, our family has been in the business for a hundred and twenty- four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's as if he has opened a flood gate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my family. Benjamin, you are my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tears run down his anguished face... Benjamin's still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry not to have told you before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin hasn't moved. The words ring in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were born the night the great war ended... Your mother died giving birth to you... I thought... I thought you were a monster... I left you on the back steps of a house... I promised your mother I'd make sure you were safe... I should never have abandoned you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin's dead quiet... He looks at this man, his father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin and Thomas in a hallway leading to the kitchen of the large house... The hallway filled with: photographs of the Button Family. Thomas pointing out relatives... Family photographs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A great uncle, from Germany. (and a group picture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the men in the family at the Lake House... (notices the date on it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1915, three years before you were born. A photograph of an old man sitting in a wooden deck chair on the dock of a lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandfather at the summer house on Lake Pontchartrain. When I was a boy I would love to wake up before anybody else and run down to the lake to watch the day begin. It was as if I was the only one alive. And they've come to a young Woman's photograph... who could only be Benjamin's mother. He stops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love with her the first time I saw her. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's name was Caroline Murphy. She was 20. She worked in your grandfather's kitchen...She was from Dublin... Her father, your maternal grandfather, was a chimney sweep... He died in the flu epidemic of 1900... Caroline came with her mother, two sisters, and four brothers in 1903 to live in New Orleans. They stop at the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would find reasons to go to the kitchen... just to look at her...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He does just that... Looking through the round window into the empty kitchen... as if she was there those years ago... as if she was still there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The happiest day of my life was April 25th, 1918 the day I married your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move along the hallway... Benjamin looking at the photographs... his bloodlines... After some moments:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and take your rightful place... with your family... with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Benjamin doesn't say anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can catch up for all the lost time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he still doesn't answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm planning on leaving everything I have to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His "bribe" strikes a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin turns his back and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin standing by the door, Queenie sitting up in her bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unforgiving, angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's what?! All those years he's creeping around here, and never tells us who he is?!! I thought he was just queer or somethin' comin' around here... always askin' for you... He left us $18 that night you was found... Eighteen ratty ass dollars and a dirty diaper...! Now he wants to be your father? He wants you to sit at his side...! He wants your forgiveness! I won't ever forgive him for any of it... God's the only one that can forgive him! (finished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I got to get up early with Mrs. Hamilton... or she gonna drown... (but not finished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He thinks he can just show up, and everything gonna be fine and dandy, everybody gonna be friends... He got another thing coming... And with that she turns over, to go back to sleep, Benjamin quietly leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs the back stairs to his room, as if he's carrying a terrible burden... as he comes onto the hallway, Mr. Daws is sitting on a bench in the hall... Seeing Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you I was struck by lightning seven different times. Once, I was walking my dog along a country road. And we see just that, when suddenly he's struck by lightning. The dog, unharmed, licking his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm blind in the one eye...I can't hardly hear...I get twitches and shakes out of nowhere... I lose my line of thought... but you know what... God, for some reason, keeps on sending me a wake-up... It's His way of reminding me I'm lucky to be alive... (a beat, sniffs the air) Storm's comin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And   gets up and pads off into his room. Benjamin, left the   hallway...He goes over to look out the window, like the   boy we remember looking out at the street lights... the   street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin being let in by a Butler into the fashionable home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin in the dark hallway, quietly walking among the photographs of "his" family. He goes up the staircase. He goes to his father's room. He quietly opens the door. The room's dark, his father asleep. He goes to his father's bed. His father's frail figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Thomas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas awakens...seeing Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin wheeling his father in a wheelchair out of the house...And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The endless lake. And we see Mr. Button's chauffeured car driving along the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's stopped at a chain across the driveway of an old summer home. Benjamin helps to put Thomas into his wheelchair. He wheels him up the long drive to the house.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: All closed up. Shuttered. There are steps that lead down to the lake. He starts to wheel his father down the steps. The steps are too steep for the wheelchair. Benjamin reaches, picking his father up out of the chair. He carries him down the steps, but that too is arduous... And he puts his father on his back...His father holding onto his son, as Benjamin carries him on his back down the steps to the dock. There's an old wooden deck chair. He helps his father sit in the chair. And as his father sits for the last time, watching the lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin sitting at a distance behind him...Both of them watching the day begin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be mad as a mad dog at the way things went...You can swear, curse the fates, regret everything you ever did... but when it comes to the end... You have to let go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as his father shuts his eyes, sitting in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I buried him in the Button family plot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin standing at his father's gravesite in the family plot, with ornate headstones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a tailor sew onto his best coat -- a button for every year of his life....fifty-five of them... all different, pearl and silver, brass and wood... in case he lost one along the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he stands at the gravesite... He hears something. Queenie has come to be with him...to comfort him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (why she's here) Don't you suffer alone for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his arm, always there for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) It's a beautiful cemetery... And buried here right next to your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her) His wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they stand at the gravesite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to pay a visit to the button factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin with an elderly woman, MS. SANDERSON, standing at the railing of a mezzanine above the factory work floor... looking down upon the workers, exclusively women, and exclusively white women, making buttons...The women, seeing him, look up, and there's a sudden hush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Benjamin, Benjamin... (for the first time) Button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare up at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, my father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still sounds strange to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My father, Thomas Button... recently passed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked that I take over the day to day operation of Button's Buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They silently stare up at him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know the first thing about buttons...and I don't know a thing about business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Button's Buttons has been in my father's family for over 100 years. It could not have survived without people like you. My father asked me to tell you how much he appreciated the hard work you put in for him and his company for so many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead still... And after a moment;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have decided that all of you -- his loyal employees, will have a share, depending on your length of employment, in the ownership of this factory, his legacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the owners now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're literally dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Sanderson will explain how everything works and will answer any of your questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he turns, walking away...Having "given away the store"... the workers in disbelief looking up at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I went to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a cab pull up and Benjamin, in a nice suit, flowers in hand, daisies, gets out, hurrying into The Majestic Theater, the marquee telling us "CAROUSEL," is performing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, coming in late, being shown to his seat. And we see the production of Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical "Carousel," with Mielziner's seminal stage design, as choreographed by Agnes De Mille... And we see the dancer is Daisy...dancing with the man of her dreams, the "bad boy" carnival barker... while Benjamin watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin, flowers in hand, making his way through a crowded backstage corridor filled with friends and well wishers giving cast members congratulations. He comes to the door... to the attention of a STAGEHAND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a friend of Daisy's... The man matter-of-factly opens the door... A dressing room crowded with dancers changing out of their Costumes... He calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy has company... We can hear Daisy's name being said...Benjamin waiting... He sees Daisy, in a robe, coming through the room....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's looking for me?... ...And she sees it's Benjamin. And rather than excited to see him... She's startled he's there... and not altogether pleased about him showing up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin... What are you doing here? And he realizes, as most of us have in one love affair or another, whatever his expectations may have been, his fantasy, is not the reality...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd come visit... spend some time with you if I could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you would have called... You caught me by surprise. He gives her the flowers, the daisies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't take my eyes off of you... you were mesmerizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so nice of you to say... These are lovely... Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There's an awkward moment... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get changed... a group of us are going to a party... would you like to come...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody told me about a restaurant I thought you might enjoy... I made a reservation... Just in case --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) ...all the dancers go out together after the show... You're welcome to come with us... There'll be all sorts of interesting people... Let me get changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she runs back inside the dressing room... Benjamin left to stand in the hallway....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loft elevator opens depositing Benjamin and Daisy along with a bunch of people into a large loft... crowded with her friends, dancers and show people, musicians, predominantly young people, straight and gay, beatniks before there were beatniks, bohemians... Music playing... People pressed together, having to shout to talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I met her friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she turns to a kitchen to get him a drink, she is startled as a young man, DAVID, suddenly grabs her, kissing her, a kiss that's not intended to be platonic... Daisy obviously involved with him... but embarrassed by the intimacy in front of Benjamin and not wanting to hurt his feelings... she pulls awkwardly away from him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my friend David... David dances with our company too... This is the man I've told you about, Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands... Daisy, wanting to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you that drink. - -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she goes into the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were her grandmother's friend or something like that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Daisy comes back out with a drink for him... and one of her own... But before she can give him his drink, a woman takes it from her... and starts to dance with her... but not with her... the way dancers do... and many of the dancers are dancing just because they feel like it... David, comes to dance with Daisy... Benjamin standing watching Daisy dancing with him... as only dancers can... in complete control of their bodies and yet totally uninhibited... Benjamin sees David kiss her... and his jealousy getting the best of him, he turns and leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy in her turban... listening to Caroline read..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) I knew I'd hurt you... Maybe I intended to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin on his way out of the apartment coming along the street. Daisy running after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what you told me to... enjoy my life... I'm only going to be young once... I had no idea you were coming. What did you think I was going to do...? You can't expect me to just drop everything, Benjamin... this is my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see DAVID and a group of her dancer friends have come outside down the way into the street... looking for cabs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Daisy) There's a party downtown we're going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conflicted, to Benjamin) Why don't you come with us, Benjamin... There'll be a lot of musicians, interesting people there.... You'll have a good time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to tell you I made a mistake before...A day doesn't go by that I don't regret it...It's not the way I felt...I should have never let you go...I came because I hoped I could be with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, you going to come...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabs have pulled up... She's torn... between her life and some other life... Benjamin, recognizing her conflict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy in bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy snaps back to the reality of the room... Starts to put the pieces together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the dancers scrambling getting into the taxis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) Okay. Okay... I'll see you in New Orleans...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He turns to go... she's motionless, caught between the two worlds... And we expect her to yell after him, to stop him... But instead, she does what we all do in these moments, what feels good at the time... She runs to be with her friends... She gets into a taxi... The cab drives by him as they leave... Daisy turned to look out the back window... looking back at him... He waves... letting her go... And another chance for them is missed... The street's quiet. And hands in his pockets, a middle-aged man going on 26... he walks off into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembers) He came to tell me his father had died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was 23...I just didn't care...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's quiet with her thoughts... and, remembering, she hums to herself some distant memory of music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...There are some photographs I think... the zipper part of the large bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline goes to the suitcases... she comes back with a manila envelope... Daisy dumps them out...and we see they're photographs of Daisy dancing at the height of her abilities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen these... You never talked about your dancing very much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy looks at the photographs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was as good as I was ever going to be. For five years... I danced everywhere... London, Prague, Vienna, and I was the only American invited to dance with the Bolshoi... It was glorious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Daisy, five years older, her arm inside a tall young blond Russian dancer's, ANITOLY, crossing a snowy street in Moscow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Benjamin was never far from my thoughts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy in bed, the young Russian dancer Anitoly lying beside her, asleep... Daisy, looking off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd find myself saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin in bed, turning off the light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd find myself saying... (a beat, saying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Daisy. And as they both lie in their beds... thinking of the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Life wasn't very complicated..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin on Tizzy's old motorcycle riding along the backroads of the endless swamps known as the bayou -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want you could say I was looking for something... As he rides away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life went on as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin in work clothes on a ladder, painting some old window shutters... Queenie opens the window... to tell him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. La Tourneau just passed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin nods. Queenie shuts the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until one day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Messenger on a bicycle rides up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a telegram for Mr. Benjamin Button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes down the ladder. The Messenger gives him the telegram and getting his tip, rides off, Benjamin opens the telegram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin, carrying a suitcase, running along a street in Paris... looking for an address... He stops, in front of an old HOSPITAL... runs up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin crosses an old tile floor to a reception desk... He asks for Daisy... a Woman calls up for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will just be a minute... please have a seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin sits in the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes we are on a collision course and we just don't know it... Whether it's by accident or by design, there's not a thing we can do about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman in Paris was on her way to go shopping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she had forgotten her coat... and went back to get it... And when she had gotten her coat the phone had rung... and so she had stopped to answer it... and talked for a couple of minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see just that,..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while the woman was on the phone; Daisy was rehearsing for that evening's performance at the Paris Opera House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we See Daisy, in her late twenties now, at the peak of her abilities, rehearsing for that evening's performance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while she was rehearsing... the woman, off the phone now... had gone outside... to get a taxi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman standing in the street, hand raised, looking for a taxi. A Cab comes to a stop....she moves to get it... but somebody gets there first...the cab driving off... and as she waits for the next cab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a taxi driver... had dropped off a fare earlier... and had stopped to get a cup of coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi parked... Its Driver finishing a cup of coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the while Daisy was rehearsing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see just that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the cab driver who had dropped off the earlier fare, and had stopped to get the cup of coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: had picked up the lady, who was going shopping... who had missed getting the earlier cab... We see the Woman riding in the taxi of the now familiar cab driver... the taxi, has to stop for a man running across the Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi had to stop for a man crossing the street who had left for work five minutes later than he normally did... because he forgot to set his alarm... We see the man sleeping... The silent alarm clock on the bedstand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...While the man, late for work, was crossing the street... making the cab wait... Daisy, finished rehearsing, was taking a shower. And we see...Daisy showering,..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...While Daisy was showering; the taxi was waiting outside a Boutique for the woman to pick up a package... which hadn't been wrapped yet because the girl who was supposed to wrap it... had broken up with her boyfriend the night before and forgot to... The Girl standing outside the back of the Boutique, crying, brokenhearted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the package was done being wrapped... The woman, who was back in the cab... the taxi was blocked by a delivery truck... We see the Taxi blocked by a delivery truck... the cab driver honking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the while Daisy was getting dressed... Daisy getting dressed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delivery truck pulled off and the taxi was able to go... The taxi, moving off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Daisy, the first to be dressed, waited for one of her friends who had broken a shoelace... We see her friend breaking her shoelace while tying it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the taxi was stopped, waiting for a traffic light... We see just that, the taxi stopped for a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and her friend came out of the theater... Daisy and her friend, carrying their dance bags, coming down the steps out of the theater, coming along the street to the corner... They start to cross the street... Daisy, showing her friend a tight pirouette, when we see the Taxi, rounding the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if only one thing had happened differently... if only the shoelace hadn't broken... And we see the shoelace not breaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or the delivery truck had moved moments earlier... The delivery truck leaving earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or the package had been wrapped and ready... because the girl hadn't broken up with her boyfriend... The girl and boy happily kissing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or the man had set his alarm and got up five minutes earlier. The man's alarm going off, waking him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or the taxi driver hadn't stopped for a cup of coffee... The Driver passing by the cafe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or the woman had remembered her coat... The woman remembering to take her coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And had gotten into an earlier cab... The woman getting into the other cab... she beats somebody for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and her friend would have crossed the street... Daisy and her friend crossing the street... Daisy, showing her friend her dance move, doing a pirouette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the taxi would have driven by them... And we see the taxi turning the corner, driving safely by them... and becoming a ghost... of what might have been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But life being what it is... a series of intersecting lives and incidents... Out of anyone's control... the taxi did not go by... and the driver momentarily was distracted... The Driver wipes cigarette ash from his shirt front momentarily looking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he didn't see Daisy crossing the street... Daisy and her friend crossing the Street, Daisy doing the Pirouette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and that taxi hit Daisy... And we see just that... Daisy being slammed into by the taxi... thrown a distance... lying crumpled in the Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin coming into the hospital room in France...Daisy, fully immobilized, lying in a hospital bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her leg was crushed... She's still, her eyes closed. Sensing him, she stirs. And then she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend wired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very kind of you... to come all the way here, to see that I was alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have done the same for me... And her first reaction, to how young he is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, look at you. You're perfect.... Which she isn't... She's quiet, and she suddenly says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you hadn't. I wish you hadn't come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to see me like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns over... as if she didn't see him he wouldn't be there... Before he can say anything... A Nurse comes in saying something in French... She pulls the curtains around the bed... Benjamin waits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her leg had been broken in five places.... and with therapy, and time, she might be able to stand...maybe even walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse leaves... Benjamin comes into the circle of curtains... It's reminiscent of when they sat under the table... the sheets over them... in their private world... But this time she lays in the hospital bed her back to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get a room... and once you can leave you'll come home with me to New Orleans. Where you can be with people who love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What home? Who's we? I'm not going back to New Orleans. New Orleans is your home... I don't have a home... I haven't been home for five years... I'm not going anywhere with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll stay here in Paris... I'll help you with anything you need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin...! I know I'm feeling sorry for myself... But it wasn't supposed to be like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand, I don't want to be with you... I tried to tell you that in New York... You just don't listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not little children playing under the table... Remember, when you came to New York. You didn't belong there. I didn't want to be with you then, I don't want to be with you now! I want you to leave! I'm not going anywhere with you! I want you to stay out of my life! And she turns away from him again...It's dead still... and we look at her staring at the curtains... And after some moments she turns back to look at Benjamin... And there are just the curtains billowing in the breeze... Benjamin is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was awfully cruel. He didn't understand. I couldn't have him see me that way... She waits for Benjamin's response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I didn't leave right away..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I stayed in Paris for awhile, just to look out for her..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin in Paris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin in Paris, "watching over her."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy in bed...She winces with pain... her breathing becoming ragged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the nurse... She goes into the hall... Daisy left to deal with the remnants of her mortality... The Nurse coming into the room... Caroline behind her... times her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you comfortable. She raises the morphine level...straightens her covers...she stops before she leaves...motions to Caroline...Caroline going over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse rate's slowing...She's getting less oxygen...You'll notice her struggle to breathe...Will you be alright? Caroline nods...The Nurse gives her a compassionate look and leaves...Caroline stands, her arms protectively across her chest, watching her mother...Daisy hums the particular ragtime song that Benjamin would play on the piano...She opens her eyes, as if not completely sure where she is...telling Caroline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every morning Monsieur Foley leaves eggs and bread and mil,. There's a cafe across the street. People sitting and drinking and talking... I lay on my bed thinking about the rest of my life... about people... about home... until I fall asleep. She looks at Caroline as if to say, "What happened to him...?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) He said, "I went back..." But then there are a whole lot of pages torn out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at a loose piece of paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...I listened to the sound of the house..." I think I already read that... (looking) The next thing he wrote... he spilled something on it... It's hard to read... Something about "sailing." Does that make sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in her own reality) A man would go up and clean it. Try and fix what was broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man up on the clock doing just that. Closing its face. The cherubic angels pushing the hands on its way backwards... "1960."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a SAILBOAT out on the lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned to sail on an old boat of my father's from the Lake House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, the wind in his hair, sailing an old sailboat... And the change in his appearance is startling... His hair is without a trace of gray... His face with barely a wrinkle, chiseled...He is a healthy man in his 40s now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't lie, I did enjoy the company of a woman or two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and a Woman standing on the sidewalk outside a restaurant, in the middle of an ardent kiss... As a taxi pulls up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin at the door kissing another Woman goodbye...going home

dialogues.speaker: MORNING, 1960
dialogues.text: Benjamin's door opening...Another Woman, disheveled, coming out of his room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or maybe three... Benjamin seeing her to the stairs...And as she starts down the stairs to leave...we see a cluster of old people, ready for the day, looking up at them...the woman making her way awkwardly down the stairs and out the door...Benjamin gives a little self conscious wave to the old timers and starts back into his room...He slows at a second story hallway window...looking outside at the walkway...the familiar street beyond...If we didn't know any better he seems to be waiting for someone to come home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the spring of 1962...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin riding the old motorcycle along the street on his way home... leaves the motorcycle out in front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to the gate, opening it, coming into the yard, shutting the gate behind him, going up the walkway. An Old Man is on the porch, quietly rocking. And Queenie, for some reason is standing just outside the front door on the porch... an apron in her hands... She nods to Benjamin... talking to the Old Man in the rocking chair... but she seems to be watching Benjamin, as he walks around the house -- to the back door. He takes off his dirty work boots, leaves them on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hops the back steps, and starts to open the kitchen door, when it opens... And DAISY, now 36, but still with her unmistakable blue eyes, is standing before him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other in silence...and they simply smile, so glad to see each other after all the missing years... They embrace...for some time... and kiss... As people who haven't seen each other, and have thought about each other... for a very long time... And it just is...no big symphonies, no endless skies...just, two people at a kitchen door in the middle of their lives... and the simplicity, just that, is what makes it real and breaks your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A radio plays... they sit at the kitchen table, eating dinner... the conversation muted... They don't know really where to begin, where did they leave oft...so they don't begin until they can....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know where I've been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't care where you've been -- I'm just happy you're back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Queenie has come into the kitchen... in her nightgown now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pure Queenie) How come you didn't write or nothin'? Just disappearing like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was what I needed to do for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never took you to be selfish. I hope I'm not wrong. I'm not usually wrong about people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Queenie leaves the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still taking care of you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Benjamin slightly smiles. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not talking. You haven't said more than two words to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to ruin it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they sit quietly in the kitchen, looking at each other, silently eating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin carries her bags upstairs. They reach the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the years seem to surround them. They walk along the corridor to Daisy's room. What was her grandmother's room. She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets her bags down. Queenie despite her reservations has left some clean towels on the bed for her... There's an inept quiet. The two of them with nothing left to say... And they listen to the quiet... The house with its symphony of night noises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is just at the door... when she says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her. They look at each other. And they kiss, A kiss that has waited for thirty years. A kiss that has waited a lifetime. And yes, there is passion... and need... but most particularly, the awkwardness of people discovering each other for the first time... While he gently, tenderly, kisses her, undresses her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want to know?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they kiss and caress each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lived in Lyon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy undressing one another, touching, kissing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I learned to walk again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Benjamin, naked, passionately kissing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I worked in a flower shop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lay on the bed, kissing, caressing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I went to American movies a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss more and more passionately...And Benjamin about to make love to her hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't hurt me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her scarred crooked leg. Kisses her body.     A as they make love in the old bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked her to come with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What follows feels like a HOME MOVIE...without any sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the small sailboat out on the gulf coast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sailed into the Gulf... along the Florida coast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Benjamin on the sailboat at a cove on the Florida coast. They watch a ROCKET, soaring into space from Cape Caniveral.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As they watch it roar overhead, Benjamin marvels at its power...leaving its trail across the sky...Daisy, not so much interested, taking his arm, taking him back down below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy washing her hair off the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat anchored. Benjamin and Daisy sitting on the deck having a picnic with just a single lamp for light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat in still another cove. Daisy and Benjamin in the water. Just their eyes above the dark water looking only at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under millions of stars. Benjamin and Daisy making love on a blanket on the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy asleep on a secluded beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat out on the water, Daisy sitting on the deck, the wind in her hair... Benjamin at the wheel...threatening clouds on the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad we didn't find one another when I was 26... I'm glad we missed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small Caribbean hotel. We see Benjamin and Daisy sitting at a table drinking, talking in a nearly empty bar... wind and rain lashing the hotel... waiting out a tropical storm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't have this... We wouldn't be here... It happened when it was supposed to happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relationships have a time and a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I mean is... You don't usually get more than one chance. If you miss it, it's too late... and it's gone... We're lucky... we had more than one chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) That's easy for you to say... You'll have plenty of chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tenderly touches his hand... They look at each other... And dedicating herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to enjoy every moment I have with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter's come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had a Sazerac with whiskey not brandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm with you, aren't I?   I'll try anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the wind changes direction, the rain coming in through the open windows of the bar, getting them wet... people run for cover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet I can stay out here longer than you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you can't. And as they both sit doggedly in the rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white hotel room... The storm shutters closed... The wind and the rain banging at the shutters... Daisy and Benjamin lying together on a bed out of the storm... She touches his face as if for the first time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You barely have a line, a crease, or a wrinkle... Everyday I have more wrinkles you have less... He touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your wrinkles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it feel like growing younger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'm always looking out of my own eyes... They're quiet, just the sound of the rain and the chattering shutters... She lays closer to him... warmly... She smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you still love me when I can't stand straight... when my skin grows old and spotted... Benjamin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you still love me when my step gets slow... when I sleep too much... when you have to push me in a chair... And his answer is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you still love me when I have pimples. When I think it's funny to make fart noises...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you still love me when I think all girls have cooties... Will you still love me when I wet my bed at night... Will you still love me when I'm afraid of things that aren't real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other... And Benjamin says... from what he's seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing lasts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some things last...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anything not come to an end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's something you can't see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a shutter slams open... the rain and the wind coming into the room... Benjamin gets up to close it... He comes back into bed... And Daisy, suddenly afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cold, Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he holds her in the white room with the wind and the rain trying to get in, banging on the shutters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm's died down... Benjamin and Daisy falling asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that she's stopped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, slightly confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. When did you meet Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Robert... some time after that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever tell him about this Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew enough. He loved me as I was. I loved him for who he was. What more was needed? She trails off... she's quiet... and wanting to know what's next, reading on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That night, in the Caribbean I had a visitor..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy sleeping... the shutters quietly talking on a breeze... when one of the shutters SLAMS open as if somebody's come in... Benjamin wakes up... And he literally sees QUEENIE is sitting on the side of the bed beside him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you I love you and your mama's gone... And she bends, sweetly kissing him... And Benjamin rolls over... His eyes come open... Daisy sensing he's awake, awakening, murmurs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenie came to tell me she loved me... and that my mother was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...go back to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she caresses him... falling back to sleep... the shutters talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy and Benjamin, with their few belongings, returning home... They go up the walkway... Benjamin trots up the steps, opens the screen door and goes inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin comes inside... Daisy's just behind him... The front room is empty... The house still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Hello... Queenie... we're back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into the parlor... The piano... He goes down a hallway into the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenie...?   Mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody... He goes down the hall looking in Queenie's small room under the stairs... Nobody's there... He moves back into the front room... calling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Anybody here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When finally an old Woman, who's been sleeping, comes out of her bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Benjamin, Mrs. Carter... Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin... your mother died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church crowded... And we see Benjamin and Daisy coming in the back as the service is ending... They are the only white people there. Benjamin walks to the open casket... standing by his mother's side as the choir sings a Hallelujah chorus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We buried her beside her beloved Mr. Weathers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A predominantly African-American cemetery... overgrown and old... The mourners, almost all of them old white people, standing at Queenie's gravesite alongside her beloved Mr. Weathers. We see Queenie's daughter among the mourners... in her early 30s herself now... And Benjamin, standing over his mother's grave... saying his goodbyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are meant to lose the people we love. It's how we know how important they are to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so we could have memories of our own I sold my Father's house on Blaine Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old house, in a now decaying New Orleans neighborhood... but despite the faltering area, the house retains a dignity of its own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a young pregnant Woman, a renter, being shown by Benjamin along with a Real Estate Agent, around the old house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's such a lovely place... You must have a lot of fond memories. It must be hard for you to give it up. Benjamin doesn't say anything. There's a knock on the door. Benjamin opens it, to let an OLDER MAN in... quite a bit older...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mrs. Williamson here yet... I'm sorry to be late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he sees his wife... pleased to see her... hugging her... tenderly kissing her... and their age difference readily obvious... Benjamin acutely aware of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful old place, darling... I think we will be so happy here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go into the hallway lined with the family photographs... She's taken by them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what a long family history you have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come with the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we bought a house of our own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy sitting on the front steps of a suburban New Orleans townhouse, a small screened front porch with a tree in front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) I loved that house... it smelled like firewood... The chimney leaked smoke... We didn't care... Oh don't stop dear... don't stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It was one of the happiest times of my life..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had no furniture to speak of... we would have picnics in the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy having a picnic on the virtually empty living room floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slept on a mattress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin and Daisy sleeping on a mattress on the floor in the bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We vowed never to go to bed or wake up at the same time. We lived on that mattress... And we see just that, a short film of two people who can't get enough of each other living on a mattress... Daisy and Benjamin at various times, while they are either sleeping, or talking, or eating, or reading, or making love, ON THE MATTRESS ON THE FLOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our neighbor, Mrs. Van Dam was a physical therapist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy in the screened-in front porch, exercising her leg under the supervision of an older woman... MRS. VAN DAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lived four blocks from a public pool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy in a bathing suit, resting from swimming, holding on to the side of the pool, watching a young, well conditioned girl, 18, with nothing but her life ahead of her, completely in tune with her body, swimming laps... And as it comes to all of us, painfully aware of the years passing, her own physical mortality, she starts to cry... And we see that Benjamin, come to meet her, is standing above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the chlorine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at the young girl... looking at her... understanding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chose something to do... something so special... so unique... there was such a short period of time that you could do it... Even if nothing had happened ... Sooner or later you would be in the same place you are now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's quiet... she knows what he's saying is true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like getting old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, Daisy holding onto him, riding the old motorcycle along the lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy sits in the familiar deck chair his father had sat in looking out at the lake... Benjamin brings her a cup of coffee... He sits on the deck on his heels beside her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, I'll never lose myself to self-pity again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they watch the day begin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think, right there and then, she realized none of us is perfect forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window has started to rattle again... the wind knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the wind had shifted away...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Daisy doesn't say anything, lying still, staring off... her breathing shallow, laboring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) I don't remember if I turned the lights off. Did I leave the heater on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse, on her way by, seeing her distress... coming in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you comfortable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently covers her... Daisy quietly lies back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting ready to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Caroline and turns and leaves the room. Caroline quietly looks at her mother. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the most beautiful eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline reaches to hold her thin hand. Daisy says something to herself. Caroline looks at her...she looks down at the book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said, "She found peace."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (says to herself) Peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small dance studio... a scratchy phonograph record playing music... young girls learning how to dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opened a dance studio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Daisy, in a long skirt over a long sleeved leotard... wearing slippers...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The first time we've seen her dressed like this in many a year... happily teaching young girls how to dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy alone... cleaning up... music playing on the record player... and for a brief moment she stops, and dances... the smallest, most tentative of steps... she sees in the studio's mirrors Benjamin's been silently watching her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still beautiful to watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at herself in the dance mirror... just what happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancing is all about the line... the line of your body...after awhile... you lose the line... and you can never get it back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other in the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured out if you were born in 1918... 49 years ago... I'm 43... we're almost the same age... In three years we'll meet in the middle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what she doesn't say, what they both know, is she's going one way and he's going the other...Benjamin affectionately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) We finally caught up to each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, starts to turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay just like that... I want to remember what we look like right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stay like that for a moment longer... She turns to get her things... She shuts off the lights... She takes his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was far too old... I'm pregnant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops... They look at each other, she smiles, nodding "yes," it's true. And deeply moved he takes her in his arms... grateful...touching her face... holding her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped) You were pregnant? You never said anything, did you? I mean, what happened to the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful) The child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure what more she is about to say, her breathing rasps... she's having some difficulty breathing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) They said if you needed oxygen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to breathe on my own... Please...(and) sit down, my darling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline respects her wishes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wanting her to continue) I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Caroline wanting to know what happened herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She flourished..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes closed, murmurs) Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She was happier than I had ever seen her..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy riding a street car, talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I heard the nurse slip, and say "he..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they ride Benjamin looks over watching a father sitting with his child... Daisy notices his look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Daisy sitting at the window at one of the booths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy with a hot Fudge sundae and a tuna sandwich... Benjamin just some coffee... They're quiet... And Daisy says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What's your worst fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it has...what if its like me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll love it all the more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be father... not a little brother... I don't want to be picked up from elementary school by my kid... I don't want anyone babysitting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make this work... This is what I want, and I want it with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there's nothing I wouldn't do for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell a blind man he can't have children? You will be a father for as long as you can. I know the consequences. I accepted that. Your love, loving you, is worth everything to me. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the fiftieth time today I've got to go pee...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He smiles... She gets up and goes to the restroom. He sits with his thoughts... and he notices a television's on... a news report... something catches his eye... someone swimming? He gets up moving to the television... where he hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on television) The oldest woman to ever swim the English Channel arrived in Calais today... having made the swim in thirty-four hours, twenty-two minutes and fourteen seconds... the sixty-eight year old Englishwoman, Elizabeth Abbott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see dear ELIZABETH ABBOTT, coming out of the water, completing the English Channel swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on television) Anything's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she smiles, after a lifetime of waiting, triumphant... And Benjamin smiles for her, and for himself, too... where anything is possible... Daisy's come beside him...
