dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves some money. He takes her arm... and as they go outside, moving along the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a day like any other in the spring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin in the bedroom, putting on a shirt... getting dressed... And there's the sound of something falling... and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he runs out of the room... to see Daisy, fallen, sitting on the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: a glass of milk spilled on the carpet... and blood on her nightdress... he runs to a phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me an ambulance... My wife is seven months pregnant and fell on the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin... the baby's coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hurries to her side... and as she clasps his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics are there... tending to Daisy, Benjamin at her side, as she struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gave birth to a five pound four ounce baby girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see, lying on Daisy's chest, is a newborn baby... Benjamin, standing beside her... And a young Woman Doctor that's there... packing up her things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure there's nothing wrong with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a normal, healthy baby in every way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Benjamin moved, kisses the baby's head... as he looks at this precious child of his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We named her Caroline, for my mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Benjamin holds Daisy's hand while she nurses her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline's stopped reading... dead still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my father...? This Benjamin was my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you ever tell me...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't change for a moment who you are. You were a gift. Sometimes the gifts we are given are not free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never said a word to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline, upset, gets up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go for a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enigmatic) My dearest darling, we were both deprived of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy lying still... in her turban... her blue eyes... her breathing rasping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline stands in the hall. The bustle of the hospital, the exigencies of life going on about her. The Nurse, seeing her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can get to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Caroline, unable to hold it in, can't stop bitter tears from running down her face... The Nurse is called for... She goes off down the hallway... Caroline takes another moment and goes back into the hospital room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, seeing her come back in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried you weren't coming back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) You're all I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the rest of it, darling.

dialogues.speaker: 244B CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Caroline hesitates, then sits back down, and quietly takes up the "book."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You grew, like the doctor had said, normal and healthy..."

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, 1969
dialogues.text: The room's dark. We see Benjamin in bed, the baby sleeping between him and Daisy... And as Benjamin watches them sleep... he looks at his reflection in a wall mirror... his 51st year on this earth... 34 years old... a young man... He looks at his baby... he looks at Daisy... in her mid 40s... her hair's begun to gray... her face begun to show the natural touches of age... His stare awakens her... She looks at him sensing he's deeply troubled... He shuts his eyes... she watches him sleep, Daisy as troubled as he is... but for very different reasons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin is sitting with Caroline while she plays in a park's sand box... Caroline helping herself to a mouthful of sand... Benjamin, trying to get the sand out of her mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat sand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy comes over to sit with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to have a really attractive diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they sit watching Caroline playing in the sand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should find a real father for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs someone to grow old with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll learn to accept whatever happens... She loves you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs a father not a playmate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that my age is starting to show...? Is that what you are telling me? Have you lost your desire for me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need another child to raise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to leave me, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your first birthday. We had a party... the house was filled with people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birthday party. A cake with a big number "1" candle. One-year-olds not having a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fathers and mothers were there... He looks at the age appropriate mothers and fathers with their children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you look around they'll be in High School dating. Benjamin manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember your first birthday like it was yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is empty, the guests gone... Daisy busy cleaning up from the party. She stops to look outside, at the backyard. Benjamin is sitting on a lounge chair... the baby, in her party dress, sitting on his chest... As Daisy stands at the window watching him with their baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1969 Benjamin, dressed, watching Caroline in her crib, asleep. Daisy in bed, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold the summer house on Lake Pontchartrain... I sold my share of Button's Buttons... I sold the sailboat... I put it all into an account for your mother... And before you would ever remember me... And he bends to kiss his sleeping daughter, whispering to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know I love you...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stops to put a bank book on the dresser, along with a house key... the sound of the key is just enough for Daisy to stir. He starts to leave... He turns to go... and he sees Daisy is looking at him... A look not so much of anger, or hurt, not of resignation, but a look of acceptance... that this is what her life is now... He crosses out of the dark room silently closing the door behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left, so that you and your mother could have a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the old motorcycle out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I left with just the clothes on my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts the motorcycle, and with just the shirt on his back he rides away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1969 Daisy still lying in bed, the sound of the motorcycle driving away. She gets up. She takes the baby out of her crib and into bed with her, holding her baby in the bare light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, in her regal turban, silently looking out the window... the wind knocking loudly again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost wish I didn't know any of this. (she's quiet, after a beat) I feel odd, reading...it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.    I never heard from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline, distant, picks through the book...She comes upon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are postcards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all addressed to me... They're from all sorts of places...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're for my birthday. (reading) 1970...I would have been two... "Happy Birthday." "I wish I could have kissed you goodnight." (reading, another one) "Happy Birthday, you're five." "I wish I could have taken you to your first day of school." (reading on) "Happy Birthday six-year-old." "I wish I could be there to teach you how to play the piano..." (reading on) "11..." "...Told you not to chase some boy..." "13..." "Held you when you had a broken heart..." "1983." I was fifteen. "I wish I could have been your father. Nothing I ever did will replace that..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy murmurs... Which brings Caroline back to the book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) What I think is..."

dialogues.speaker: 252A AROUND THE WORLD
dialogues.text: And Benjamin's voice comes in... WHILE WE SEE HIM IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...What I think is, it's never too late...or, in my case, too early, to be whoever you want to be...There's no time limit, start anytime you want...change or stay the same...there aren't any rules...We can make the best or worst of it...I hope you make the best...I hope you see things that startle you. Feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people who have a different point of view. I hope you challenge yourself. I hope you stumble, and pick yourself up. I hope you live the life you wanted to...and if you haven't, I hope you start all over again." When we come out of those images...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline finishes reading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... I hope you start all over again..." It's quiet...just the wind knocking...She looks at her mother...but Daisy's staring, somewhere else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes up reading again...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been gone for a long time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd been gone for a long time... To the Dance Studio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A record's playing piano music. Classes are done. Parents taking their children. We see Daisy, in her long skirt... helping pick up with her hands and her nimble toes, errant clothing, the jackets, the sweaters...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It takes us a moment to recognize her... in the some twelve years since we've last seen her, 56 now, her hair's cut short... and it's gone mostly gray... and, although her age is on her face, she still has a dancer's posture, her head held high... carrying herself with grace... and one thing that will never change, are her unforgettable blue eyes... We hear the door opening... Daisy, busy gathering, saying her goodnights... glances toward the door across the studio... And she sees a young Man has come in, a young man in his twenties... standing silently, a stranger, standing by the door... Daisy, as she closes up the studio, makes her way toward him, saying goodnight to people... she bends to pick up a ballet slipper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody left their slipper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy looks over, the young Man hasn't moved... the studio has all but emptied... she walks toward him... he's wearing worn trousers, a coat that's seen better days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here to pick someone up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes "no." Coming closer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we're closed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to open the door to show him out... when she gets a good look at him. She stops, realizing who it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she's taken aback by his youth, we all are... sixteen years younger... in his 20s now... it's at once staggering and heartbreaking... what age can do... And she realizes, at that very moment, he was right all along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other... When she's able to find the words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see you both. She stares at him... just the piano music. And despite the gulf of time... there's a terrible aching they have for each other... and before they can say anything... the door swings open and Caroline, 12, comes hurrying in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready, Mom? Benjamin stares at her appearance... And Daisy, can't help herself, and seeing Caroline, Daisy, overcome by it all, starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... He was telling me a very sad story about a mutual friend we hadn't seen in a long time... This is my friend, Benjamin... you knew him when you were... just a baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... He reaches, taking her hand... needing to touch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... And a Man 50s, wearing a suit and a tie, comes in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I thought you were done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a friend of my family's... Benjamin Button... this is my husband... Robert... They shake hands... There's an awkward quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice to have met you... We'll be in the car, darling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just closing up... And Robert and Caroline go outside to wait for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so lovely... she looks like you... Does she dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose that would be from my side of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a dear sweet girl... she seems a little lost... But who isn't a little lost at 12? There's a lot of her that reminds me of you. And she shuts off a set of the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband. He's a doctor... was a widower... He's an incredibly bright, adventurous man... Benjamin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been a terrific father... and a great partner and friend... And she shuts off the record player and another set of lights... and for a moment they stand in the dark studio... and they look at their reflections in the mirror... seeing who they are now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so much younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what you can see. She looks at him, and after all these years... she now understands completely... she looks outside at her daughter standing by the car with her "father," waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ware right. She needed a father. I couldn't have raised both of you. I'm not that strong. He's quiet.   They both are.   She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought how it must have broken your heart, too. His silence is enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you staying? What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the Pontchartrain Hotel on the avenue. I have no idea what I'm going to do. And it seems like they want to hold each other. But they can't. It's still. And aware of the car's headlights waiting at the curb... she turns, holding the door open for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. He nods.   He walks by her, going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops to lock the door. She turns, getting into the car... and leaves... Benjamin stands on the corner, hands in his pockets, the car driving by him... and Daisy can't help but look at him... and then the car's gone... and as he crosses the street and walks off into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That young man was my father? And a Nurse comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hurricane changed directions again. They are predicting it will make landfall sometime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything we need to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrangements are being made to move people if we have to. I'll let you know as soon as we know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me what he says?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline looks at the book.       And Benjamin's voice co in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That night..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, sitting on the end of the bed, not sure why he came there at all... There's a sound at the door...as if somebody was there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its quiet...a hesitancy...He starts to get up and there's a knock on the door...He opens it...and Daisy's there. He's startled to see her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes inside...an awkward quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm doing here...What I expected...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It echoes how she's feeling being there...They stand not knowing what to say...And Daisy says, sadly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a finger to her lips. He shakes "no."       And w he's come to know, that some things do last...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never once stopped loving you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He affectionately pushes a hair off of her forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old woman now, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he helps her off with her coat... She's still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her... and she's quiet... and he undresses her... undressing himself... and they stand momentarily naked... the young man and the older woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things you don't ever forget... the feel... the taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he kisses her again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the smell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his mouth by her cheek... breathing her in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the touch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caressing her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of someone you love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benjamin standing at the window watching as Daisy gets into a taxi... the taxi starting to drive off... and Daisy turning... to look back... waving to him. Benjamin waving to her... what they both somehow know, is a last goodbye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched her go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..and as the taxi drives away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until she went out of sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the taxi going down the street and out of sight... for the last time... Despite losing sight of her he still hasn't moved... standing by the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, breath raspy, sitting silently in her bed looking out the window... We realize Caroline's stopped reading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last thing he wrote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's quiet... they both are... alone with their thoughts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him after that last time with you, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind has picked up considerably, rattling the window even harder..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year or so after your father passed... There was a call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Daisy in her bathrobe, in her sixties... drinking a cup of coffee... the telephone rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Yes?... Speaking -- I don't understand? Where was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy riding in the back or a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks outside, and we see up ahead of her, the Nolan House standing like a monument to time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy gets out. The taxi drives off. Daisy stops for a moment before she opens the gate. The house has fallen into disrepair. A solitary old man sits on the porch rocking and rocking. She goes up the walk and out of habit goes around the back porch... to the kitchen... going inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes into the kitchen. She moves down the hallway into the living room... The interior has also fallen on hard times. Some old people are still in residence -- predominantly African Americans now... Queenie's daughter, now in her fifties herself, stands in the living room... Along with a plain Man in a plain suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming... I'm David Hernandez with the Orleans Parish department of Child Welfare Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenie's daughter turns on a lamp... it doesn't work... she crosses the room to turn on another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was found living in a condemned building off of east Lamont... the police found this with him... this address... and your name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he gives her the journal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in very poor health... he was taken to the hospital... He doesn't seem to know who or where he is... He's very confused... The doctors who looked at him think he may be autistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Mr. Hernandez about Benjamin bein' one of us. I told him if he needs a place to stay... it's alright... he can stay here... he is blood after all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just then we hear a PIANO playing... as if it were being played by a child... with no skill... banging as much as anything... And Daisy follows the sound of the piano into the parlor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she sees his back... just a boy of 12 now... hunched over... trying to play the piano... trying to play the tune the woman had taught to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns at the sound of her voice. There is no indication he recognizes her at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this song?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he tries to play what he thinks is the song, but is nothing more than a child playing random notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play really beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes and touches his back... He shrinks from her touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't seem to like to be touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while he tries to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors said if they didn't know any better, he goes in and out of states of recognition, as if he had the beginnings of dementia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's looking at the boy, who was once the man she loved... who she still loves... She looks into his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me?   I'm Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.    No sense of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy is a very pretty name. I'm Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to meet you Benjamin. Do you mind if I sit with you? I would love to hear you play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't say anything. She sits down beside him on the piano bench. He stops to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something about you... There's something about your eyes I remember from a long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her eyes. She looks at him... And as she sits with him on the piano bench... as he tries to play... Daisy and Benjamin, "together again..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenie's daughter saw to it that he was taken care of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, just eight now... coming into the kitchen... Queenie's daughter cleaning up after breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just ate breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just finished eating, Mr. Button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't know what you are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like an eight year old, or an old man old with onset Alzheimer's -- which makes him nearly a helpless child, he starts to rage... throwing things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are all fucking liars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every day I would stop by... and make sure he was comfortable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just then Daisy comes into the kitchen.       She see raging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't believe he's already had his breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if we can find something else for you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset, meaning lapses) I can't help it. I can't help this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she puts her arm around him, taking him out of the room, understanding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many times he would simply forget who and where he was at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Daisy sitting on a bed with Benjamin in his room on the second floor of the old house... And he's oddly lucid...more articulate than his age would indicate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the feeling there's a lot of things I can't remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like there's this whole life I had and I can't remember what it was... He's frustrated by it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright... It's alright to forget things... And as she sits on his bed with him... in the upstairs room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, no more than six now, standing on the ROOF... Daisy standing on the ground down below him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd come down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see everything. And he points out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see the big river... all the boats... I can see the graveyard where mama's buried and all those other people... I can see the city... where you have your dancing place...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And tears fill Daisy's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, you can see everything sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he can... he can see all the way across to the Mississippi River... the old graveyard... the city... his whole life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better come down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I could fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it looks like he might just try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping him) I knew a man who could fly. Come down and I'll tell you all about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's quiet, thinking about that. And acquiescing, he turns up the roof out of sight... some short moments...and he comes running out the front door... his hands in his pockets like the brave little man he is... Daisy bends down... and as he runs into her arms... Daisy holding him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy propped in her bed looking out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I went to take care of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Daisy, in her seventies now, carrying a suitcase, coming up the walkway, and onto the porch... old people sitting in the porch chairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was five, I think, when I moved in... the same age I was when I had met him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, 5 now, sitting on the porch swing, staring off... and he drools like a helpless old man. Daisy stops, taking out a handkerchief, wiping the drool off his chin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you like to help me unpack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, unpacking her suitcase with Benjamin's help, taking out an alarm clock, a quilt, some photographs... The "Just So Book.." Her personal things... moving in... Benjamin, playing with the alarm clock, making the alarm go off... again, and again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin in a small child's bed. Daisy, sitting on his bed reading from Kipling's "Just So" stories to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the picture of old Man Kangaroo at five in the afternoon, when he got his beautiful hind legs just as Big God Ngong had promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The days passed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Benjamin, just three or so now, holding Daisy's hand, walking with her in some autumn leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched as he forgot how to talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin almost two... sitting On Daisy's lap in the front room... and saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin... (points to her) Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... Benjamin and Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud of himself he smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How to walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see him, just like a toddler, barely able to stand... Daisy there to catch him from falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched him sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, sitting on the porch on a rocking chair. Benjamin, just a baby now, some months old, sleeping in her lap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2002, they put a new clock on the train station wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see a workman on a ladder taking down the old clock of "Mr. Cake's"... handing it down to another workman...and putting up a new clock... a digital clock... The time moving... the way it's meant to be... going forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy in her hospital bed... the wind howling at the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the spring of 2003...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows dapple the room. Daisy sitting in    an old chair in the middle of the room... with daylight   streaming in on her... holding Benjamin on her lap... a   tiny thing now... nearly newborn... he can almost fit   in her two o hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked at me... And we see him looking up at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked into my eyes... And we see him looking into her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he moved his fingers... and with his little thumb he held my thumb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and that's just what he does... looking into Daisy's eyes...holding her thumb with his tiny hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he had said... no matter what age he was... he was the same person behind his eyes... and, at that moment I knew... he knew who I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby staring into her blue eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he closed his eyes like he was sleeping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see his eyes flutter and softly close... forever. And as he lays in his beloved Daisy's lap... completely still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind a full out hurricane.    The lights flicker.   S on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to see what they want us to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she gets up, the "book" drops on the floor.      A card's fallen out. Caroline picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a train schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns it over.    There's writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm on a train in India filled with people."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overcrowded train car... people sitting and standing and lying on the seats and on the floor, in every available space, nook and cranny, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only one who isn't sleeping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see Benjamin sitting on the floor among all of the people, the only one awake, writing on the back of the train schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I figured out one thing. If you're growing older or getting younger it really doesn't make any difference. Whichever way you're going you have to make the most of what this is."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at all the people sleeping around him... strangers on a train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Along the way you bump into people who make a dent on your life... Some people... get struck by lightning..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see just that... Mr. DAWS being struck by lightning again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some are born to sit by a river."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we see just that... Mr. Oti sitting by his river...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some have an ear for music..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the unnamed older woman playing the piano...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some are artists..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we see Captain Mike... with his tattoos -- standing on his tug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some swim the English Channel..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we see Elizabeth Abbott doing just that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some know buttons..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We see Thomas Button holding a button in the palm of his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some know Shakespeare..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tizzy reciting Shakespeare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some are mothers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Queenie pointing at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And some people can dance..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we see Daisy dancing... forever young...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started to write something else... "I'm going..." But he stopped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently puts the card back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had known him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still.    And the wind reminds her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better go and see what they're planning to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy nods. Caroline goes out of the room... It's quiet. Daisy's alone now... looking out the window... at the howling, hurricane... a hundred mile an hour fury... And fighting against the wind, trying to reach the window is a hummingbird... it almost makes it and is pushed back by the gale... but undaunted, its wings doing a figure eight... the symbol for infinity... it fights its way through the wind to the window... tapping at the window... and the hummingbird flies away... she watches it go... and after some moments she says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she closes her eyes for the very last time... and it's dark... where it's peaceful, even safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the new clock high on the terminal wall running the right way... going forward... and as the clock turns... people hurrying to their destinations, living their lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storage room. Old track signs. Old waiting room chairs. The discarded, and forgotten. And lying on its side under an old tarpaulin -- is "Mr. Cake's" clock... the angel still pushing the hands... running backwards... forever...
